trans-unit.source: Build a device selector
trans-unit.target: Build a device selector

trans-unit.source: Building a device selector will enable you to limit the devices you are searching through when enumerating devices.
trans-unit.target: Building a device selector will enable you to limit the devices you are searching through when enumerating devices.

trans-unit.source: Build a device selector
trans-unit.target: Build a device selector

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Devices.Enumeration
trans-unit.target: Windows.Devices.Enumeration

trans-unit.source: Building a device selector will enable you to limit the devices you are searching through when enumerating devices.
trans-unit.target: Building a device selector will enable you to limit the devices you are searching through when enumerating devices.

trans-unit.source: This will enable you to only get relevant results and will also improve the performance of the system.
trans-unit.target: This will enable you to only get relevant results and will also improve the performance of the system.

trans-unit.source: In most scenarios you get a device selector from a device stack.
trans-unit.target: In most scenarios you get a device selector from a device stack.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might use [**GetDeviceSelector**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264015) for devices discovered over USB.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might use [**GetDeviceSelector**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264015) for devices discovered over USB.

trans-unit.source: These device selectors return an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string.
trans-unit.target: These device selectors return an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with the AQS format, you can read more at [Using Advanced Query Syntax Programmatically](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Bb266512).
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with the AQS format, you can read more at [Using Advanced Query Syntax Programmatically](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Bb266512).

trans-unit.source: Building the filter string
trans-unit.target: Building the filter string

trans-unit.source: There are some cases where you need to enumerate devices and a provided device selector is not available for your scenario.
trans-unit.target: There are some cases where you need to enumerate devices and a provided device selector is not available for your scenario.

trans-unit.source: A device selector is an AQS filter string that contains the following information.
trans-unit.target: A device selector is an AQS filter string that contains the following information.

trans-unit.source: Before creating a filter string, you need to know some key pieces of information about the devices you want to enumerate.
trans-unit.target: Before creating a filter string, you need to know some key pieces of information about the devices you want to enumerate.

trans-unit.source: The [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of the devices you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: The [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of the devices you are interested in.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how **DeviceInformationKind** impacts enumerating devices, see [Enumerate devices](enumerate-devices.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how **DeviceInformationKind** impacts enumerating devices, see [Enumerate devices](enumerate-devices.md).

trans-unit.source: How to build an AQS filter string, which is explained in this topic.
trans-unit.target: How to build an AQS filter string, which is explained in this topic.

trans-unit.source: The properties you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: The properties you are interested in.

trans-unit.source: The available properties will depend upon the [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991).
trans-unit.target: The available properties will depend upon the [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991).

trans-unit.source: See [Device information properties](device-information-properties.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Device information properties](device-information-properties.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: The protocols you are querying over.
trans-unit.target: The protocols you are querying over.

trans-unit.source: This is only needed if you are searching for devices over a wireless or wired network.
trans-unit.target: This is only needed if you are searching for devices over a wireless or wired network.

trans-unit.source: For more information about doing this, see [Enumerate devices over a network](enumerate-devices-over-a-network.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about doing this, see [Enumerate devices over a network](enumerate-devices-over-a-network.md).

trans-unit.source: When using the [**Windows.Devices.Enumeration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) APIs, you frequently combine the device selector with the device kind that you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: When using the [**Windows.Devices.Enumeration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) APIs, you frequently combine the device selector with the device kind that you are interested in.

trans-unit.source: The available list of device kinds is defined by the [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) enumeration.
trans-unit.target: The available list of device kinds is defined by the [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) enumeration.

trans-unit.source: This combination of factors helps you to limit the devices that are available to the ones that you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: This combination of factors helps you to limit the devices that are available to the ones that you are interested in.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify the **DeviceInformationKind**, or the method you are using does not provide a **DeviceInformationKind** parameter, the default kind is **DeviceInterface**.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify the **DeviceInformationKind**, or the method you are using does not provide a **DeviceInformationKind** parameter, the default kind is **DeviceInterface**.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Enumeration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) APIs use canonical AQS syntax, but not all of the operators are supported.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Enumeration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) APIs use canonical AQS syntax, but not all of the operators are supported.

trans-unit.source: For a list of properties that are available when you are constructing your filter string, see [Device information properties](device-information-properties.md).
trans-unit.target: For a list of properties that are available when you are constructing your filter string, see [Device information properties](device-information-properties.md).

trans-unit.source: **Caution** Custom properties that are defined using the `{GUID} PID` format cannot be used when constructing your AQS filter string.
trans-unit.target: **Caution** Custom properties that are defined using the `{GUID} PID` format cannot be used when constructing your AQS filter string.

trans-unit.source: This is because the property type is derived from the well-known property name.
trans-unit.target: This is because the property type is derived from the well-known property name.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the AQS operators and what types of parameters they support.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the AQS operators and what types of parameters they support.

trans-unit.source: Operator
trans-unit.target: Operator

trans-unit.source: Supported types
trans-unit.target: Supported types

trans-unit.source: COP\_EQUAL
trans-unit.target: COP\_EQUAL

trans-unit.source: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32
trans-unit.target: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32

trans-unit.source: COP\_NOTEQUAL
trans-unit.target: COP\_NOTEQUAL

trans-unit.source: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32
trans-unit.target: String, boolean, GUID, UInt16, UInt32

trans-unit.source: COP\_LESSTHAN
trans-unit.target: COP\_LESSTHAN

trans-unit.source: UInt16, UInt32
trans-unit.target: UInt16, UInt32

trans-unit.source: COP\_GREATERTHAN
trans-unit.target: COP\_GREATERTHAN

trans-unit.source: UInt16, UInt32
trans-unit.target: UInt16, UInt32

trans-unit.source: COP\_LESSTHANOREQUAL
trans-unit.target: COP\_LESSTHANOREQUAL

trans-unit.source: UInt16, UInt32
trans-unit.target: UInt16, UInt32

trans-unit.source: COP\_GREATERTHANOREQUAL
trans-unit.target: COP\_GREATERTHANOREQUAL

trans-unit.source: UInt16, UInt32
trans-unit.target: UInt16, UInt32

trans-unit.source: COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS
trans-unit.target: COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS

trans-unit.source: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array
trans-unit.target: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array

trans-unit.source: COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS
trans-unit.target: COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS

trans-unit.source: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array
trans-unit.target: String, string array, boolean array, GUID array, UInt16 array, UInt32 array

trans-unit.source: COP\_VALUE\_STARTSWITH
trans-unit.target: COP\_VALUE\_STARTSWITH

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: COP\_VALUE\_ENDSWITH
trans-unit.target: COP\_VALUE\_ENDSWITH

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: COP\_DOSWILDCARDS
trans-unit.target: COP\_DOSWILDCARDS

trans-unit.source: Not supported
trans-unit.target: Not supported

trans-unit.source: COP\_WORD\_EQUAL
trans-unit.target: COP\_WORD\_EQUAL

trans-unit.source: Not supported
trans-unit.target: Not supported

trans-unit.source: COP\_WORD\_STARTSWITH
trans-unit.target: COP\_WORD\_STARTSWITH

trans-unit.source: Not supported
trans-unit.target: Not supported

trans-unit.source: COP\_APPLICATION\_SPECIFIC
trans-unit.target: COP\_APPLICATION\_SPECIFIC

trans-unit.source: Not supported
trans-unit.target: Not supported

trans-unit.source: **Tip** You can specify **NULL** for **COP\_EQUAL** or **COP\_NOTEQUAL**.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** You can specify **NULL** for **COP\_EQUAL** or **COP\_NOTEQUAL**.

trans-unit.source: This translates to a property with no value, or that the value does not exist.
trans-unit.target: This translates to a property with no value, or that the value does not exist.

trans-unit.source: In AQS, you specify **NULL** by using empty brackets \[\].
trans-unit.target: In AQS, you specify **NULL** by using empty brackets \[\].

trans-unit.source: **Important** When using the **COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS** and **COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS** operators, they behave differently with strings and string arrays.
trans-unit.target: **Important** When using the **COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS** and **COP\_VALUE\_NOTCONTAINS** operators, they behave differently with strings and string arrays.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a string, the system will perform a case-insensitive search to see if the device contains the indicated string as a substring.
trans-unit.target: In the case of a string, the system will perform a case-insensitive search to see if the device contains the indicated string as a substring.

trans-unit.source: In the case of a string array, substrings are not searched.
trans-unit.target: In the case of a string array, substrings are not searched.

trans-unit.source: With the string array, the array is searched to see if it contains the entire specified string.
trans-unit.target: With the string array, the array is searched to see if it contains the entire specified string.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to search a string array to see if the elements in the array contain a substring.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to search a string array to see if the elements in the array contain a substring.

trans-unit.source: If you cannot create a single AQS filter string that will scope your results appropriately, you can filter your results after you receive them.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot create a single AQS filter string that will scope your results appropriately, you can filter your results after you receive them.

trans-unit.source: However, if you choose to do this, we recommend limiting the results from your initial AQS filter string as much as possible when you provide it to the [**Windows.Devices.Enumeration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) APIs.
trans-unit.target: However, if you choose to do this, we recommend limiting the results from your initial AQS filter string as much as possible when you provide it to the [**Windows.Devices.Enumeration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225459) APIs.

trans-unit.source: This will help improve the performance of your application.
trans-unit.target: This will help improve the performance of your application.

trans-unit.source: AQS string examples
trans-unit.target: AQS string examples

trans-unit.source: The following examples demonstrate how the AQS syntax can be used to limit the devices you want to enumerate.
trans-unit.target: The following examples demonstrate how the AQS syntax can be used to limit the devices you want to enumerate.

trans-unit.source: All of these filter strings are paired up with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) to create a complete filter.
trans-unit.target: All of these filter strings are paired up with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) to create a complete filter.

trans-unit.source: If no kind is specified, remember that the default kind is **DeviceInterface**.
trans-unit.target: If no kind is specified, remember that the default kind is **DeviceInterface**.

trans-unit.source: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **DeviceInterface**, it enumerates all objects that contain the Audio Capture interface class and that are currently enabled.
trans-unit.target: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **DeviceInterface**, it enumerates all objects that contain the Audio Capture interface class and that are currently enabled.

trans-unit.source: **=** translates to **COP\_EQUALS**.
trans-unit.target: **=** translates to **COP\_EQUALS**.

trans-unit.source: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **Device**, it enumerates all objects that have at least one hardware id of GenCdRom.
trans-unit.target: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **Device**, it enumerates all objects that have at least one hardware id of GenCdRom.

trans-unit.source: **~~** translates to **COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS**.
trans-unit.target: **~~** translates to **COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS**.

trans-unit.source: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **DeviceContainer**, it enumerates all objects that have a model name containing the substring Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **DeviceContainer**, it enumerates all objects that have a model name containing the substring Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: **~~** translates to **COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS**.
trans-unit.target: **~~** translates to **COP\_VALUE\_CONTAINS**.

trans-unit.source: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **DeviceInterface**, it enumerates all objects that have a name starting with the substring Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **DeviceInterface**, it enumerates all objects that have a name starting with the substring Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: **~<** translates to **COP\_STARTSWITH**.
trans-unit.target: **~<** translates to **COP\_STARTSWITH**.

trans-unit.source: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **Device**, it enumerates all objects that have a **System.Devices.IpAddress** property set.
trans-unit.target: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **Device**, it enumerates all objects that have a **System.Devices.IpAddress** property set.

trans-unit.source: **<>\[\]** translates to **COP\_NOTEQUALS** combined with a **NULL** value.
trans-unit.target: **<>\[\]** translates to **COP\_NOTEQUALS** combined with a **NULL** value.

trans-unit.source: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **Device**, it enumerates all objects that do not have a **System.Devices.IpAddress** property set.
trans-unit.target: When this filter is paired with a [**DeviceInformationKind**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn948991) of **Device**, it enumerates all objects that do not have a **System.Devices.IpAddress** property set.

trans-unit.source: **=\[\]** translates to **COP\_EQUALS** combined with a **NULL** value.
trans-unit.target: **=\[\]** translates to **COP\_EQUALS** combined with a **NULL** value.
